topic: French government crisis: PM Bayrou's ouster, Lecornu's appointment, and nationwide protests.
evaluation: The articles detail the continuous story of France's political crisis, starting with the anticipation and eventual ouster of Prime Minister François Bayrou, followed by the appointment of Sébastien Lecornu, and culminating in widespread protests and strikes against the new government's policies. All articles are strictly relevant, developmental, and chronologically consistent, forming a comprehensive narrative. No entire articles were deemed noisy or irrelevant; thus, no de-noising of articles was required. The slight mention of Poland/Belarus in one article was a minor aside and did not detract from its core relevance to the French story.
